fields.description:
When loading SourceTree (I've tried 1.8.2.11, and several older and newer versions) I get the inisital screen to accept the license agreement.

When clicking Next, the application crashes with the Windows 'searching for solutions'. I've tried running as an administrator, and repairing / reinstalling related .NET frameworks.

The SourceTree log file remains empty, and Windows reports the following:

{color:red}Problem Event Name:	CLR20r3
Problem Signature 01:	SourceTree.exe
Problem Signature 02:	1.8.2.11
Problem Signature 03:	56d8a994
Problem Signature 04:	System
Problem Signature 05:	4.6.1055.0
Problem Signature 06:	563c0ff8
Problem Signature 07:	3c92
Problem Signature 08:	0
Problem Signature 09:	System.AccessViolationException
OS Version:	6.1.7601.2.1.0.768.3
Locale ID:	2057
Additional Information 1:	1151
Additional Information 2:	11516ed220ed88e7dffa6276db703fe6
Additional Information 3:	2ab1
Additional Information 4:	2ab1fa28d2e7fa2e368426b0ad1021f9{color}
fields.summary: Cannot accept License Agreement in SourceTree Software

tested two times, occured both, so i think it's 100% reproducible.

error log attached

might be related to SRCTREEWIN-5292

I deleted them, then went to re-add them and the first one I added gave me the "SourceTree has crashed" dialog box.

Getting an error dialog every 10 seconds after updating embedded Git version.

fields.description: When attempting to perform a partial commit of modified files at times the commit button will not become enabled.  Clicking the 'select all checkbox' to perform a full commit will enable the Commit button, but selecting individual files will not.  Closing the application and reopening it appears to correct the issue temporarily.
fields.summary: Commit Button Disabled When Attempting to Perform Partial Commit

fields.description:
Source Tree continuously crashes on my PC:

Updating to the latest version didn't help at all.
fields.summary: Source tree keep crashing - Hg log failed with code 255 abort repository

fields.description:
Get a view within sourcetree that shows a diff on the right hand side.

Now switch to a task that will alter many files (I'm using PHPMaker to generate our CMS. It takes a few minutes to do its job).

Back to Sourcetree and the view is now blank. Click a different file, as you can't reselect the existing file, and you see the diff. For about half a second as a completely unrelated file gets changed from the build process going on elsewhere.

Unless the content for the panel is different, what ever content is present should remain on screen until I decide otherwise.

It is of very annoying when you are examining a diff and are half way through the review and suddenly it vanishes because of a change to another file, unrelated to the view I am in.

It is even worse as I am looking at staged content, so it won't change unless I stage any subsequent changes. So, as far as I'm concerned, the view should simply not change.

It looks like the UI has become a bit too simplistic. Something change, update everything. And it isn't even doing that right as it leaves a blank diff when a file is selected.
fields.summary: diff keeps vanishing whilst other files are being altered.

fields.description:
I prefer using the keyboard instead of the mouse.

I can use cursor up and down to scroll through the files list.
Space selects or deselects a file.
Ctrl-Alt-C places the cursor into the commit message field.
The commit button remains disabled:
 !image-2016-03-18-09-53-03-056.png|thumbnail! 

I have to deselect and select a file BY MOUSE to enable it:
 !image-2016-03-18-09-54-12-120.png|thumbnail! 

The state of the button changes only by mouse, not by key :(
fields.summary: commit button disabled after selecting files by space key

fields.description:
In previous versions, the commit UI contains a list of staged files, a list of unstaged files and the file diff editor. When check the file(s) in the unstaged files list, the checked file moves to the staged list.

The new version by default have only one list, and only when the user choose to commit only part of a file's hunk, it switch back to the old style. But in this case all previously selected files being unchecked again. If there are a lot of files to commit and only the last one need selective hunks, this will result in lost of long time work.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open any git (I only tested this) repository that contains at least 2 files
2. Update at least 2 files with the second contains at least 2 hunks
3. In the commit UI, check the first file for commit
4. for the second, stage the first hunk only

Expected result:
SourceTree switch to two list mode, with the first file and the second file's first hunk staged.

Actual result:
Only the second file's first hunk being staged, the first file remains unstaged.

Solution:
1. when switching between the two list modes, keep track of selected files
2. provide an easy option to switch between the two modes
fields.summary: Switching from quick stage mode and traditional mode losts checked data

fields.description:
Every interaction where move files between the "Staged Files" and "Unstaged Files" causes a MODAL dialog box to pop up and interrupt the task of moving files between these two areas prior to a commit. 

Quite annoying, and seems unnecessary - was not there before.  

At a minimum, provide an option in preferences and in the dialog to not show the modal dialog when files change from staged to unstaged and back.  Makes me want to drop backt to the command line for this.

Thanks for your continued work on this product - it is very useful!
fields.summary: Annoying New Modal Dialog Box on EVERY interaction with list of staged and unstaged files
There is a display error in sourcetree diff view

fields.description:
Before the new UI overhaul, the colored icons were a godsend for easily identifying the state/status of each project. Now, all icons are grey and lifeless, and imho, it is extremely awkward seeing right away the status of each project. Perhaps, the old UI needed an overhaul, but please bring back the RED, GREEN and other useful color coded icons.

Thanks,
Michael Mussulis
fields.summary: Colored icons - please bring them back...!

fields.description:
When I add a new .sj file
and when it is still unstaged
then it shows the content in the diff view of Source Tree
But when I stage it
the diff view does not display the content anymore
And when I commit it
the diff still does not display it
The encoding of the file is utf-16. I know that I can set SourceTree to use utf-16, but then other files have issues. I am just wondering why it displays the content while it is still unstaged.
fields.summary: Diff view does not display file content after staging

fields.description: When viewing the branch structure for older commits in ancestor order, SourceTree appears to create branches from nothing, giving an inaccurate history.
fields.summary: Ancestor-based branch tree not formulating correctly

fields.description:
If the selected language is French, Fetch and Pull action are under the same name which is "Récupérer". It's a bit confusing, for the time being I think itùs safer for me to work with the English version, but I guess some people will use the French one.

I don't really know how to translate clearly those terms in french, but you have some equivalent like "retirer" or "rapporter". I guess the if you asked me, fetch could be "récupérer" and then pull could be "retirer".

Regards,
Mickael
fields.summary: Fetch and Pull are under the same name in french version

fields.description: this repeats for me on viewing diff of large files, e.g. built js-files, plese see the screenshot
fields.summary: No new line... message overlaps code with wrapped lines

fields.description:
In previous versions of the SourceTree user could step on a file and the context menu gave an opportunity to open Windows directory with this very file highlighted.

In the current version we have "Explorer" menu icon/option on top of the screen, which delivers the same functionality.

But it is counter-intuitive to click on icon on top to get action applied to file highlighted closer to the bottom of the screen in "File Status", "Log/History" or "Search" panels.

It is more reasonable to expect that icons on top will act on entire highlighted branch.
And all of the icons except "Explorer" act on an active branch or on entire repository.

*Please, plug "explorer" functionality to open directory for particular file into a right-click context menu for highlighted file.*

It also makes sense to *change the current "Explorer" icon action to something applied to repository*. Maybe open the topmost directory of the repository, where ".git" sub-directory is located.
fields.summary: Return "open explorer" to the right-click context menue

fields.description:
# open hg or git repo
# change a file
# click Commit button
# select a file
# hit space 

expected: file is checked, commit button is active
actual: file is checked, but commit button is disabled
workaround: check file with a mouse

fields.description:
Behavior : When typing up a comment for a commit, if you click anywhere inside the panel that is outside of the text box (and not a button or the selectOption menu), the "Push changes Immediately to origin/master" checkbox gets set to TRUE. 

Desired Result: The checkbox should only be set to TRUE when clicked.

This has affected prior releases of SourceTree, but unfortunately I have not kept track of which ones.
fields.summary: Onclick Event Action Space Encompasses Entire Panel - Causes Undesired Push of Commits to Remotes Origin

Now you have to scroll way down to the end of the chunk, use the horizontal scrollbar (how much you need to move it?) and scroll up again to actually see the area you want.
I think nobody want to work with this bahvior and this should be improved to permanently show (all relevant ?) scrollbars ...
fields.summary: Scrollbar is out of reach

fields.description:
Sourcetree does not convert the backslashes of the path where the new subtree should be added to slashes, see this example:

{code}
$ git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false subtree add -P Applications\Windows\KeyBoxControl\ProjectRef
erences\nagios-nsca-client https://user@server/stash/scm/ac/nagios-nsca-client.git master
git fetch https://user@server/stash/scm/ac/nagios-nsca-client.git master
From https://server/stash/scm/ac/nagios-nsca-client
 * branch            master     -> FETCH_HEAD
Added dir 'ApplicationsWindowsKeyBoxControlProjectReferencesnagios-nsca-client'
{code}

As you can see the path of the subtree has been changed to one single directory because sourcetree sends the wrong path format in the command
fields.summary: Add Subtree ignores Path delimiter when creating new subtree link

fields.description:
1. Perform "discard hunk" action
 !image-2016-03-16-17-11-43-409.png|thumbnail! 

2. The file should restore to its original state, instead the whole content was 'changed', but nothing was really changed, lines are removed and added back as the app shows.
 !image-2016-03-16-17-12-37-677.png|thumbnail! 

It happens on one of my Visual Studio projects, but seems ok on other java/scala project. I'm using one sourcetree to manage them all. I'm not sure if it is a GUI issue or a git issue, however it is really annoying. Its been like this since v1.6, and I just updated to 1.8.11, still there.

Any idea?

Thanks!
fields.summary: "Discard hunk" creates a change of the whole content

fields.description:
As outlined in http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q1/645 , we are potentially vulnerable to remote code execution (the actual bugs trigger heap overflow) as sourcetree for windows bundles version 2.7.3 of git.

Update to a version of git that addresses CVE-2016-2324 and CVE‑2016‑2315 (git 2.4.11, 2.5.5, 2.6.6 and 2.7.4 all have the fix).
fields.summary: Update to a version of git that contains a fix for CVE-2016-2324 and CVE‑2016‑2315

fields.description: Since the 1.8.x versions have been released, SourceTree is constantly asking for Authentication for the remote server - Bitbucket specifically.  This happens almost every 15 minutes, even though the account credentials are stored under accounts.  When interacting with repos, everything works fine, and you are not asked for the authentication.
fields.summary: SourceTree is constantly prompting for authentication credentials.

fields.description:
This seemed to be the case with the last two updates I applied, both 1.8.2.n (I believe). I was very tempted to make this Major. As a manager, I use this a LOT for quick code reviews of commits. I have the "Allow SourceTree to modify ..." box checked. I did have the external diff set for BC3 but setting it back to System Default and restarting did not change anything. And, in any case, that option has always been available whether the diff was BC or kdiff3 or default.

Also, I had diff and difftool settings in the global .gitconfig file. But clearing those out made no difference either.

I have attached two screen shots, one from the latest version and one from 1.6.14.0
fields.summary: The External Diff menu choice is no longer available in the Log/History tab

fields.description:
When cloning a git repository from HTTPS which contains a %20 in the URL the recommended (and often accidentally accepted) folder path is copped without conversion from the last segment to become the repository folder name on disk. This causes problems with some tools such as NuGet and also looks horrible. 

Instead, could these folder names have these escaped characters converted to the actual characters?
fields.summary: URL's that have a '%' do not properly convert folder paths during CLONE's.

fields.description: After the most recent update, External Diff has stopped working in SourceTree, from File Status and Log / History tab as well as from the separate Log window.  External diff tool still works in other Git clients and there have been no changes to configuration.  External Diff / Merge tool shows as 'System Default', but fails to function even if diff tool is manually specified.
fields.summary: External Diff broken in last update

fields.description:
It's crashing again with the message:
hg log failed with code 255: abort: repository C:\Users\Users\AppData\Local\Temp\bla.hab not found!
fields.summary: hg log failed with code 255

fields.description:
I tried to select a set of lines by
#selecting the start line
#hold shift key and selecting the end line

But the start line got unselected so all ends up in a non-contigous selection!
(see screenshots)
fields.summary: Select range of lines is broken

fields.description:
The new version of SourceTree for Windows displays a popup list of the new files and a popup list of the removed files.  If this list is large then the popup window appears with the drag bar at the top and the buttons at the bottom both off the screen leaving the user unable to move the window or click a button.

To Reproduce:  Add 100 files to a project and commit.

Workaround:  The user can hit Enter to accept the files, or Alt+Space-M-Up Arrow to move the buttons into view.
fields.summary: Commit popup file list can appear with the buttons off the screen

fields.description:
I don't really expect this "bug" to be corrected, nor do I need it, because I was performing some strange and unusual operations on a repo, which is also a submodule of another repo, and I modified SourceTree's bookmarks accordingly :/
I'll try to explain:
- I had a git submodule cloned (with --recursive option when cloning parent git repo), with a bookmark on it
- I also had a bookmark of this same 'child' repo, bun in another directory of the same computer (which is not the "same", BTW...)
- I deleted the bookmark of the submodule, and choose the option "delete files on disk", cause I wanted to  re-perform a clone *without* the --recursive option
- SourceTree showed me an uncommitted change, which I think was the .gitmodule deleted
- I discarded this change (bacause I wanted to keep the dependency)
- Then SourceTree showed me, in the submodule view, a little "..." icon
- I double-clicked on the submodule
- and BAM !

Enjoy ;)
fields.summary: Crash while opening GIT submodule

fields.description: When selecting a LFS file in "Log / Historry" and Tools->Options->General->"Refresh automatically when file changes" is active, Sourtree is refreshing files about every second.

fields.description:

Workaround
You can you attempt to change to a different SSH Client. You can do this by going to SourceTree Option >> SSH Client >> change from PuttY to OpenSSH
fields.summary: Checking Source Spins when trying to clone a repo from Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
While browsing the working copy's changes of a Git repo that contains a file that has several lines modified,
1. Select the modified file either from "Unstaged files" or from "Staged files" section.
2. On the right panel, select any single line (as if you were to stage/unstage this line)
3. While holding Shift key, click any of the preceeding lines as if you were to select multiple lines

Actual result:
4. Lines between the 2nd click inclusive and 1st click exclusive plus the line after the 1st click are selected

Expected result:
4. Only lines between the 2nd and 1st click inclusive are selected.

I'm happy to share the repo with you so you can see the issue for yourself.

fields.description:
After upgrading to latest versions of ST on Win10 the response from commands became very slow. I guess it's because Git which ST runs in background for all the functionality became very slow to invoke or something. 

Clue #1: it's much slower (10 or more times) to just switch local branch or wait for uncommitted changes to be picked up in main list, so probably it's not related to network.

Clue #2: when you run Terminal from the ST toolbar the console window comes up with DirectX overlay about showing game overlay or something. Maybe way of launching git and terminal just changed to some slow kind that is not actually necessary for git/terminal?
fields.summary: The response from Git became very slow with last versions on win10

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Executing Custom Action with $FILE on a folder with a lot of long file paths will cause the custom action to fail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Custom Action with parameter $FILE to list the selected files into a file "test.txt"
# Select a folder with a lot of long file paths
# Perform the Custom Action on the folder
 
h3. Expected Results
The file "test.txt" will have all the files selected

h3. Actual Results
"Show Full Output" will show the commands with all the files selected as parameters but the command will fail to run.
The file "test.txt" is empty
 
h3. Notes
[Windows KB|https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/830473] states that Command Prompt has 8191 character limit for command line.

h3.Workaround
Run the Custom Action on a few files only
fields.summary: Custom Action with $FILE on multiple long filename will have an error

fields.description: When opening a bookmark folder for an old repository that contains a "Repository was moved or deleted" message the client crashes
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when opening a bookmark folder
Crash

fields.description:
It's so frustrating to not being able to see the status and the current branch name. (see the screenshot).
Why did you remove it???
fields.summary: Please return the status back

fields.description:
At least the Mercurial part has become so buggy, that I don't even know where to start:
* When switching to another repository, an error window pops up (twice), stating {quote}'hg log' failed with code 255: abort: repository C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Temp\2\ofszowpv.jol not found! (C:\Users\<username>\mercurial\<repository name>){quote}
* Sometimes it forgets the "All Branches"/"Current Branch" setting
* Sometimes it forgets the tab a repository was set to
* Sometimes it just hangs ("Not responding")

In the current state, the program is simply unusable.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.8.2.11 is unusable

fields.description:
SourceTree automatically detects changes in the repository and refreshes the commit view automatically.

When this happens, regardless of whether any meaningful changes happened, the currently selected file is lost.  However, it remains selected in the file list, so you have to change to a different file first before you can re-select it.
fields.summary: When list is refreshed, current selection is lost.

fields.description:
In previous versions, when copying from the diff view, only the contents of the file would be copied.

Now, the copy command includes the "+/-" from the beginning of each line.  Manually removing all of these is tedious in certain text editors, and they are rarely (if ever) actually desired.
fields.summary: Copying from the diff window now includes " + " or " - " at the front of each line.

fields.description:
Hi Jira Team,

Thanks for the contribution to source tree.

My version is 1.8.2.0
whenever I want to copy paste the green part which is the extra lines I added in the code, I will get a failure and it closes the application. I know that I can download the changed file and then just replace the file, however I want to be able to just copy paste the changed lines, I think it is obviously reasonable. 

Thanks.
fields.summary: copy of the file content fails

fields.description: I find the tab functionality in SourceTree annoying. It makes me click repos in the bookmark view, thinking they are in focus now, and pulling the wrong repo then. The bookmark view is totally sufficient for me, and I think that tabs are unneccessary in this context. *Once I (single) click a repo in the bookmark view I want to directly have this repo in focus.* Please add an option to disable tabs.
fields.summary: Disable Tabs

fields.description: After updating to 1.8.2.11 a dialog was presented that Mercurial is missing. The dialog tells me that i have 3 options but presents me 4 ways to deal with that. See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Wrong number of options

fields.description:
Today I try to upgrade my SourceTree to latest (was 1.7.X, to 1.8.2.11).
After that, when +switching branch+ or +after some time+, the message will pop and leave the bottom left area (commit detail) blank, w/o commit log or commit hash. The message will keep popping when clicking on every commit.
 !SourceTree_bug.png! 

However, after "pull" function, the error will stop popping and works fine (for a while).
I also noticed that sometimes when the program find some new commit in repo(number show up at "Pull" button), this bug would also happen. 

when the problem happens, the hg command in shell still works fine, hg status, hg log,... all good

Probably the Temp/cache problem in my opinion.
fields.summary: SourceTree hg frequently popping "failed with code 255: abort: repository <temp path> not found!"

fields.description: I created a few bugs for stuff in SourceTree that is probably the fault of the 3rd party installer software that you are using and I would like to propose that you replace it with a tiny software that I came to love that is used in many great projects like Visual Studio Code and Atom: Squirrel (https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows) it is open source and should fit the needs of SourceTree quite well.
fields.summary: Suggestion on alternative installer

fields.description: See screenshot. I looks like the Installer creates and leaves behind those folders. They all contain one folder called "install" which is empty.
fields.summary: Installer leaves behind empty folders
Crash when staging several new folders
